Award.AwardTitle: Travel Awards for US based participants to attend the workshop "Recent Developments in Model Theory", Summer 2011, Ol'eron, France
Award.AbstractNarration:
We are requesting funding to support US participants, particularly graduate
students and recent Ph.D.s, to attend the international workshop Recent
Developments in Model Theory that will be held June 5-11 in Oleron France.
One of the objective of this workshop will be to bring researchers in
Model Theory and some other areas together to present and discuss problems
as well as some recent advances in these areas and thereby facilitate
further interactions. Another goal of the workshop is to provide an informal
setting where graduate students and younger researchers from US can learn
about new trends and interact with one another as well as with prominent
mathematicians.

Institution.Name: University of Notre Dame

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award provided support for US national and US-based researchers
to participate in the meeting ``Recent Developments in Model Theory
held in Oleron, France June 5-11, 2011.  The meeting was one of the
largest gatherings in model theory ever with over 140 participants
from all over the world. Speakers included most of the leading figures
in modern model theory as well as key researchers from other areas of
mathematics where model theory has had significant applications.  The
talks covered a wide range of current research in pure and applied
model theory and closely related areas.  Postdoctoral researchers and
graduate students had the opportunity to present their work in shorter
lectures and poster sessions.

The award provided  partial or full support for 26 US national and
US-based researchers including 8 graduate students, and 10
postdoctoral researchers.  5 of the supported participants were
invited speakers.  9 of the supported participants were women and 2
were underrepresented minorities.

We are currently preparing a proceedings of the conference which will
include 15-20 papers and will appear in one or two volumes of the
Notre Dame Journal of Formal Logic.  The volume will reflect the wide range of the conference including papers in stability theory, o-minimality, applications of model theory to tropical geometry, and papers in number theory and group theory related to model theory.
